column4: how can i fix an error that says "Can't create test file /var/lib/mysql/host.lower-test; mysqld does not have access rights to directory"
give access rights to that directory? usually by changing the owner of that director to the user mysql is running as (usually "mysql")
what is the exact command, i think i messed up my stuff enough. is it sudo chown -R mysql /var/lib/mysql
sounds right. try it
what's changed since yesterday?
installed lighttpd and php
which both work fine
the error you just got means that mysql is not running
but what could have caused that? i didnt change anything about the mysql stuff yesterday
i dont know
i need the databases that are in mysql, if i reinstall will it kill them?
don't reinstall, start it again
dunno how ;_;
sudo invoke-rc.d mysql start
it just failed.
so check the error log
im noob ;_; where is that at
probably /var/log/ <- somewhere, i don't know either. maybe #mysql knows more
its empty... theres a #mysql?
your entire /var/log directory is empty? i find that difficult to believe. yes, there's a #mysql. use /list to get a list of channels on freenode
i meant the mysql.log was empty
i take it thats bad D:
